question: Happy birthday, babe. They ain't diamonds, but you're just gonna have to wait for those...
answer: Thank you. Thank you so much...

question: Are you OK, hon?
answer: I...yeah...I'll be fine...It's just...that new girl...I almost hit her in the parking lot...

question: Yeah, I got one for Miss Richards.
answer: Ask away.

question: When they found the scumbag who took your precious flower of virginity, you sued his sorry ass, right?
answer: Uh, no, actually, I was never able to make a positive ID. All I remember was his alcohol-soaked breath whispering in my ear, "You won't remember, but you'll never forget..."

question: Just try to keep those legs together.
answer: Shouldn't be a problem for Miss teen Virgin.

question: Excuse me?
answer: You're Mr. Clifford, right? As in Clifford construction?

question: I am, yes, but...
answer: I'd love to see one of your erections...

question: Bet you choke.
answer: What's your major malfunction?

question: Just wanted to make a wager. Between best friends. You blow this dive, I get those diamonds of yours.
answer: How'd you know about my inheritance?

question: Talk of the town, birthday girl. Today's the day, right?
answer: And what, pray tell, are you willing to wager when I win?

question: I'll stay away from your stepfather. You make it, I won't be your new stepmom anytime soon. Whattya say?
answer: Take your sorry ass back to the swamps.

question: Choke!
answer: Nah. I'm cool.

question: It simply can't be done... In all construction there's delays.
answer: Four months is not a delay. It's a disaster.

question: You have my word, Mr. Barajas, the building is almost finished. Just give me a week, two tops.
answer: We are long past the negotiation stage. For every day the building goes unfinished, we'll take a finger...

question: This is a private party...
answer: Don't mind me. I ain't here for your stupid party.

question: Get the hell outta here! NOW!
answer: Damn girl, whattcha been drinking?

question: Stay away from my stepfather!
answer: Make me...

question: I'm going to the condos. Sleep it off, whydontcha? Not enough. Just not enough... Fuck me...
answer: Any time. Any place...

question: What are you doing here?
answer: You promised to show me your erection...

question: Is that my...camera?
answer: Lighten up, Jay.

question: Enough's enough. I think it's time you left.
answer: Is that any way to treat Marie's new best friend?

question: You're best friends are you?
answer: Sure. We've been having sleepovers. Talking about boys, swapping tips. She's been teaching me about shopping, I've been teaching her about giving mind blowing head...

question: Gimme the camera back...
answer: Come get it. Ooopppps.

question: It's present time. What the hell...
answer: What are you doing here at this time of night?

question: I just...wanted to apologize for my behavior earlier. I was out of line.
answer: When we admit our mistakes we grow. You've made an important step.

question: So...what about my present?
answer: Meet me at the Museum. Before school tomorrow. Now go home, get some sleep, I'm gonna finish up here... You really think you're ready for your inheritance?

question: It was...it was what Mom wanted...
answer: You're the only one who can open that lock, but I'm the one with the key. She wanted you to have the diamonds when you were responsible enough to know what to do with them...

question: I'm...responsible...
answer: Really? Underage drinking, prying into my personal affairs, fighting...

question: But they're mine. Mom left them to me.
answer: They're yours when I say they're yours. For the time being, I've got some major problems at the construction site. Deadlines have to be met. We'll talk again when you've done some growing up. Please, don't fight me on this. We're Team Clifford, remember?

question: Team Clifford... What the hell?
answer: Can I help you, Officer? There must be some mistake, this isn't possible...

question: Jay, what's going on?
answer: I didn't do anything, I swear. Who's 'she'?

question: Please, Detective, this isn't the right time...
answer: I ain't lying. You think I'm lying?

question: If you're telling the truth, you won't find a more sympathetic ear...
answer: 'If' I'm telling the truth...

question: Sexual predators often keep a trophy...
answer: I'm sorry?

question: Maybe he recorded the rape.
answer: And maybe he didn't. We'll never know. Tape's mangled. Forensics said it'd take months to fix it. We were never properly introduced. Michael Morrison.

question: Miss Richards. Kristen. Miami Parole. Was just in town for a couple days checking in on some parolees when all this went down...
answer: You think maybe you could lean on the girl? Get her to drop this nonsense? We all know she's lying. With all this Black widow shit going down, we just don't have the time or manpower to...

question: She might not be lying, you know.
answer: What makes you think that?

question: Just a look in her eye. I...I have some experience...
answer: What the hell?

question: What the hell?
answer: Gotcha...

question: What is it?
answer: Blood, fingerprints, sign of a struggle. I'd say we've got a rape on our hands, Detective, but we won't know for sure until we run the tests...

question: You vampires really need five pints of my blood? That's like an armful...
answer: It's standard procedure in a rape test. Test for drugs and such...

question: And such.
answer: We're going to need a urine sample. Do you think you could fill this?

question: From here? Done. Next?
answer: Those are...

question: Bite marks. He chowed down.
answer: They're clear evidence markers...

question: Dr. Borman, do your tests show that Elena Sandoval had sexual intercourse on the night of the 25th?
answer: Yes they do.

question: Do they show that it was forced?
answer: Yes. There was extensive bruising and tearing. We found no semen evidence. The latex abrasions point to the use of protection. This is quite common in cases of premeditated rape.

question: And what can you tell us about Miss Sandoval's toxicology reports, Doctor?
answer: Came back positive for Rohypnol, a common date rape drug. Traces were also found on the bottle of beer at the crime scene. Both Mr. Clifford and Miss Sandoval's fingerprints were all over the bottle.

question: Goddamn gloryhounds. They knew I was close. They just want to come in and take all the credit. Chad, I got a rush job for you.
answer: No can do, boss. We're sifting through the Black Widow evidence...

question: Feds are movin' in. They'll be taking over by the case by the end of the week. You find anything on that tape, you let me know, OK?
answer: Whatever you say, boss.

question: Nice take off. Gotta work on the landing...
answer: What the hell are you doing here?

question: Looks like your bling ain't blinging...
answer: Give me that back. It was my Mother's...

question: Looks like she got ripped off Princess, where's the rock?
answer: Is that what this is all about?

question: And why did you go to your stepfather's building site that night, Miss Clifford?
answer: It was my birthday. Jay left the party before giving me my present.

question: And you say you saw Miss Sandoval leaving?
answer: I did.

question: And how would you describe her appearance?
answer: She was...she looked fine. She smiled at me. Actually smiled...

question: Would it be fair to say you don't like Elena Sandoval, Miss Clifford?
answer: We don't see...eye to eye...

question: Is that why you attacked her at your party earlier that night?
answer: No...I was...she wasn't invited...

question: You'd had a few drinks, correct?
answer: I'd had a drink. Yes.

question: So by the time you allege to have seen Miss Sandoval, could you tell the court exactly how much you'd had to drink?
answer: A glass of Champagne. Or two, but...

question: I'm gonna lose this trial.
answer: I'm not so sure about that. The tape's a fake, right? So all we need to do is...

question: You had your chance. If we're gonna win at all costs, we're gonna have to change the game. Do you have it?
answer: I'm still dead set against this, Jay.

question: I couldn't care less.
answer: What's the key for?

question: The diamonds...If that's what it takes, then that's what it takes...
answer: But...they're my inheritance...

question: All my assets are tied up in the condos, Marie. We have to pay this girl off, make her testify that she faked the tape, faked the evidence.
answer: But, Jay...they're my diamonds...

question: As soon as I'm out of here, you'll have them back. I swear. I know people, who can...persuade her to hand them over... More wrong than what she's doing to us? We're team Clifford, right? You know I'm not guilty. You know I could never do anything like this. So do the right thing and get me out of this hellhole...
answer: I can't...

question: It is now. Take it or leave it.
answer: When this is all over, you'll leave town. For good.

question: I go more than five miles from the police station and I'm straight back in juvie...
answer: I understand your Parole term is up next week.

question: You've done your homework. Fine. As soon as this thing comes off, I'm outta here...
answer: May I suggest a little discretion, Miss Sandoval. Certain...questions might be asked about this...arrangement if you were to...say...turn up to Blue Bay High wearing a tiara...

question: I swear to tell the truth, the whole truth and nothing but the truth...
answer: It's your assertion that my client, Mr. Clifford forcibly sexually assaulted you on the night of the 25th. Is that true? Is that what you say happened?

question: He... He didn't... ....just sexually assault me.
answer: What...did you just say?

question: He didn't just sexually assault me. He threatened to kill me if I told anyone...
answer: Isn't it true that you were inebriated during the assault, that it may not in fact have been Mr. Clifford...Or anyone?

question: She want to pin me for some more crimes?
answer: No, Mr. Clifford. I just have a few questions. I've noticed some inconsistencies...

question: You've noticed some inconsistencies? Here's one big fucking glaring inconsistency for you
answer: Maybe so, but that's not good enough. Why were you set up? What would Elena Sandoval have gained from all this? But Elena's testimony was damning. Why wouldn't she play ball?

question: Later potato...
answer: What the...If anyone sees us together...

question: What choice did I have? We got big problems...
answer: Gotta be careful. Make sure no one's listening. Now what's the 411?

question: I...I think I fucked up...
answer: How?

question: I don't know for sure...but I think that bitch Parole officer's made me...she was at my trailer last night...
answer: No bigee. You disposed of everything, right? The teeth, the video, all the research...

question: I did, but...She's got a hard on for me. Wants to see me back in Juvie...
answer: I won't let the big bad wolf get you. I promise.

question: I just want outta here.
answer: Be patient. I'll call the Museum Curator, have him prepare the funds to buy back the diamonds...

question: Then we're outta here, right?
answer: Just sit back, relax, enjoy the trip...Don't forget to come again. Can I help you?

question: Just sit back, relax, enjoy the trip...Don't forget to come again. Can I help you?
answer: I was wondering if I could have a moment of your time. Ask a couple questions.

question: I'm in the middle of practice...
answer: It'll only take a moment, Marie. Might even help Jay. Remember your loving stepfather? You want to help him, don't you?

question: Of course.
answer: Why'd you agree to part with your diamonds?

question: How...
answer: Jay told me. But why? They were your inheritance.

question: Jay needed help. We're a team.
answer: Team Clifford. Right. It's just...You must've been pretty unhappy when Jay didn't give you those diamonds for your birthday.

question: He said I wasn't ready.
answer: You're 18. That's heiress payday, no? Must've crossed your mind that Jay might never let you have them...

question: No, of course not.
answer: And then this little scam artist saunters in and just takes them. With your help, no less. But what I don't get is, why wouldn't Elena do what Jay asked, clear his name? After all, she'd gotten what she wanted.

question: How should I know?
answer: I mean, the only way I can make sense of it is if somehow getting Jay released from prison would spoil the plan.

question: What plan?
answer: You tell me...

question: You tell me...
answer: Miss...Richards. Is...Is there something I can do for you?

question: I was wondering if you'd do me the favor of running a quick test.
answer: Uh, sure, I guess. Whatcha got for me?

question: Could you tell me what this is?
answer: No problemo. It'll only take a minute. Be careful, I got lots of evidence here.

question: Are these the evidence photos from the Elena Sandoval rape?
answer: They are, but...

question: Ever find out what caused these markings?
answer: Like I told the Judge, I guess they're finger nail markings...

question: They don't look like finger nail markings to me. They look more like this... Would you say these markings are the same?
answer: W-where did you get that?

question: Marie gave it to me. But you already knew that, didn't you, Doc?
answer: The pill. It's Rohypnol. Uh, Roofies.

question: Hello? What the hell, Chad? Chad fidgets nervously.
answer: That parole officer was sniffin' around today.

question: Not you too. She's just trying to prove her worthless excuse for an existence. She doesn't have a thing on us.
answer: Yeah, but she's askin' the right questions. It's only a matter of time. We gotta make our move.

question: No. We stick to the plan. Give the Curator time to come up with the money...
answer: We gotta move fast, keep the heat off...

question: You can't take the heat, get outta the kitchen.
answer: I wanna see 'em. The diamonds. Make sure they're safe.

question: They're safe.
answer: I just wanna see 'em. I thought we were

question: You're gonna be the death of me... She slugs the rest of the drink, strides away and Chad follows like a lapdog...
answer: Open it. I wanna see those puppies. Marie rolls her eyes, takes a key from a delicate chain around her neck and fumbles with the lock. Finally she opens the box, revealing the Mother-Daughter diamonds, resting on velvet lining. I called the museum. The deal's goin' down tomorrow. 8 am...

question: What did you...
answer: Yello...

question: Chad fucked us.
answer: I know. I was there...

question: No, I mean he really fucked us. He drugged me an' took the diamonds!
answer: ell me you're kidding...

question: Yeah, it's all a big joke...He stole the diamonds! Keep it down, my headache's bad enough as it is.
answer: We've gotta stop him.

question: He's heading to the museum, got himself an 8am meeting...
answer: He's gonna sell the diamonds...

question: Chad! There's nowhere to run to, you little weasel! Gotcha...
answer: This can't be happening...

question: What now?
answer: I'm more than five miles away from the Police station. I go beyond five miles and the alarm goes off...

question: You telling me your Parole Officer knows you're out here?
answer: She knows...

question: Get rid of the body. And his car...
answer: Where are you going?

question: Where do you think?
answer: I don't...I don't have a clue...

question: Chad made us an appointment to sell these. I'm gonna keep it...
answer: It's only a matter of time before my Parole Officer finds me...

question: Then I suggest you get to work...
answer: Jesus...

question: Marie? Are you alright?
answer: Never better. Got the money?

question: I convinced the board of the extraordinary circumstances surrounding...
answer: Good.

question: I...I received a call from your 'associate'. He said he would be handling the transaction.
answer: Change of plans. My 'associate' got tied up at work. Completely swamped... Calm down. It's just blood.

question: So?
answer: I...I'm not sure...

question: Can you get the cash or not?
answer: I can get the cash...it's just...

question: Then let's have those dead presidents... What the hell are you doing?
answer: One last test...

question: I told you.
answer: Told me what?

question: That if you were telling the truth I'd back you all the way. If you lied to me there'd be trouble...
answer: Chad swerved off the road, I swear...

question: Just swerved for no reason. Just decided to take a shortcut through the swamp?
answer: It was an accident...

question: Yello...
answer: The diamonds are fakes. Totally worthless.

question: No. That can't be true!
answer: Believe it. I'm leaving. Tonight.

question: You can't...what about...me...
answer: Don't you understand? There's no money. Nothing. Zip. Zilch. Zero. How am I supposed to take care of your broke ass?

question: I...I gotta see you.
answer: I'll send you a photo.

question: Please. Just one last time.
answer: I'm gone, gone, gonski.

question: I think maybe...maybe there's a way we could still get some money...
answer: Okay, talk...

question: Not over the phone. We gotta meet.
answer: School swimming pool. One hour.

question: I..don't think I can do this...
answer: It's already done. So?

question: I had no choice...
answer: Blah, blah, blah. Get over it. He's dead. Now you told me you had a plan. Spit it out.

question: Jay's got cash. At the building site. I saw it.
answer: That's your brilliant plan? It's in a safe, dumb ass. You a safecracker? Have you got magic fingers, gonna pick that lock? I don't think so. Next. Like hell we are.

question: Listen to me. We go to the jail, tell him we'll come clean, tell the police everything, if he gives us the combination. I'm still a minor, they'll send me back to Juvie. Shit, I could do that time standing on my head...
answer: How much money?

question: Enough for you and me.
answer: We don't have to tell the cops anything. We'll let Jay's videotape do the talking.

question: But, we got rid of the real one...
answer: I kept a copy. Never trusted you backstabbers. You're trembling.

question: Marie, I...
answer: Ssshhhh... Alright. Let's do it...

question: Ssshhhh... Alright. Let's do it...
answer: Well, well, well. Who'd have thought. What a pleasant surprise. I guess you guys have kissed and made up?

question: Very funny. Did you know the diamonds were fakes?
answer: Your Mom hocked them years ago. Boozed it all away. You already know the end of her sorry story... So, to what do I owe the pleasure?

question: We want money. Whatever you've got in your safe at the beach condos.
answer: Of course you do. Of course you do.

question: You will? Is that what I think it is?
answer: You give us the combination and this goes in the nearest mail box, tied with a pretty pink bow.

question: How do I know it's the real tape?
answer: You're gonna have to trust us.

question: I've been down that road before.
answer: This is non-negotiable.

question: What's the combination?
answer: I can't...

question: No such word as 'can't'...
One down...
answer: Marie! Please, I can't do this...

question: Two down.
answer: I told you not to kill Chad. I'll tell it to the police. I'll tell 'em you made me lie about your stepfather raping me, made me perjure myself on the stand, went and killed Chad, and now...

question: Runs up the fire escape stairs when a final deafening GUN SHOT rings out. Followed by SCREAMS. He rips open the fourth floor fire door, tearing through the building, pushing through thick plastic sheeting until he finds himself under the UV glow.
answer: I didn't have a choice. She was gonna kill Elena.

question: It's gonna be okay.
answer: Just got off the phone with the Parole board... They want me to bring Elena back to Miami in the morning. I'm... sorry for this whole mess.

question: Don't be. It was my gun that fired the shots, so it must've been me who pulled the trigger. I'll take the credit on this one. After all the Black widow crap I had to put up with, I've earnt it...
answer: You did the right thing...

question: We did the right thing. I will. I will.
answer: Now that this is all over, maybe we can have that drink soon...

question: How you holdin' up, Jay?
answer: Been better.

question: So what's next?
answer: No idea. Everything's gone. Repossessed. Guess there's nowhere to go but up.

question: I can't help but feel partially responsible. If there's anything I...
answer: I don't think so, but thanks.

question: Can I at least give you a ride somewhere?
answer: Ain't got nowhere to go...

question: ... but up, right? Uh, Kristen, it's Michael again. Haven't heard from you. Hope you're doing okay. Everything's fine here. Haven't been any questions asked that I can't answer, an' no one's brought your name up. So give me a call back and maybe we can go for that drink... What the hell, Dammers? It's...gone.
answer: That's right, Morrison. Every last bit of evidence from the Black Widow case. Not to mention the money you confiscated. All $427,000.

question: But how...
answer: I was hoping you'd be able to answer that question.

question: What in God's name are you talking about? I didn't have anything to do with it!
answer: Well, your key card was the last one that opened this locker.

question: I can't believe Morrison just handed me the key to the evidence locker... These are...genuine?
answer: Nothin' like the real thing. Switched 'em for the fakes right after Marie tried to pay me off...

question: They're...So beautiful.
answer: The mother.

question: Well, all that nasty business, it's behind us. Forever. From here on out, it's the good life. You two look so good, it's difficult to tell which one's the mother and which one's the daughter...
answer: That's just the roofies talking...

question: What did you say?
answer: Delta Chi, class of '88. Hellova party. I'd never really tasted cocktails like that.

question: I don't...whattya talking about?
answer: It was like being awake though an operation. I could feel everything happening, but I couldn't do anything to stop it...

question: Oh...shit...
answer: You took something from me that night. But you left something behind... Your daughter...

question: I don't remember...
answer: You may not remember...

question: You may not remember...
answer: ...But you'll never forget. Nice take off. Gotta work on the landing.

question: Let's go get our money. We got problems...
answer: Almost done here.

question: Leave it. Come on! He gonna be able to make an ID?
answer: Not on your life. I gave him enough roofies to make an elephant forget. I can't believe we just gave up all that cash.

question: Forget it. The Black Widow's finally got an angle on our real prey.
answer: We goin' to Blue Bay?

question: He won't know what hit him.
answer: 'bout time...

question: That's an awful lot of money...
answer: Who the hell...

question: Not enough though. Gonna need those Diamonds if you're gonna ride out this disaster...
answer: What? What the hell do you mean?

question: The building's built on a sink hole, Jay. You know it, and I know it. Gonna need to think fast if you wanna keep the Cubans off your back...
answer: How'd you...how'd you know all this...

question: It's what we do.
answer: We?

question: I just want what's mine...
answer: The diamonds are your inheritance. You deserve them...

question: My fucking Step-Monster'll never give me the Goddamn key...
answer: So you take it, one way or another...

question: You're blocking our sun...
answer: Ladies. Hellova job back there. Your best ever if I might be so bold...

question: This is our biggest score. You sure you can move it?
answer: Not a problem.

question: Let's see the green...
answer: Got another lead, if you're interested. Was just up in Boston, surveying a mansion that's just been sold. Termites already eaten most of it. Owner's shitting bricks. There's gotta be an angle for the Black Widows...

question: It's over. We had a good run.
answer: Shame. Guess all good things come to an end. So, the diamonds... How do I know these are the real thing?
